page.title: 19Our Waterways.
page.content: THE RIVER TRENT. The River Trent rises in the hills of North Staffordshire and flows southwards towards Rugeley through our ever widening valley. It flows eastwards and then northwards from Staffordshire to enter the North Sea at the River Humber. The valley of the Trent in Staffordshire is mostly pastureland and there are many villages along it's banks. The river is crossed at Wolseley Bridge by the A51 and there is a fine bridge designed in 1780 by James Rennie. THE TRENT AND MERSEY CANAL. The canal was built to link the River Mersey with the River Trent at its navigable point south of Derby. It was built during the 1770's. The public meeting to discuss the idea of the canal with the local landowners was held at Wolseley Bridge in 1765.
